title: Sorry, Amber Rudd, but it wasn't sexism that stopped Brexiteers voting for May's dreadful deal
text:
I've never had much truck with post-millennial feminism. The way it spoils for a fight, tin hat at the ready, whenever a woman is called "love" in the office. All it does is make mockery of the real causes on which the movement was built. Not least fair pay, equality of opportunity and, of course, the right to vote.

So it seems ironic that one of those who has most benefited from the fruits of women's advancement in recent decades should be playing the sexist card where it simply doesn't exist.

Step forward Amber Rudd who this week summoned the "whiff of sexism" to diagnose why hardline Brexit Tory MPs seem willing to back some sort of Brexit plan if and when it is presented by Boris Johnson but...
description: I've never had much truck with post-millennial feminism.
